Description: Wooden cylinder seal: perforated through the centre, bearing an incised inscription which shows a figure of a lion and a primitive shrine. The wood has slightly split and a small piece has broken from the inscribed surface.
Curator's comments: The motif is common on the Early Dynastic mud seal impressions, see P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pls.40-6; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 14-15; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 686-7, n. 43, 46; G. Godron, 'Revue d'Égyptologie' 8 (Paris,1951), 91-8; W. Helck, ‘Untersuchungen zu den Beamtentiteln des ägyptischen alten Reiches’ (Gluckstadt, 1954), 76-7. Bibliography: P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl. 43, abb. 150; G. Godron, 'Revue d'Égyptologie' 8 (Paris,1951), 97, fig. 26.
